CatDescriptText: Ernest Leech, chemical plant worker, 2525 Mahon Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 6 with question: "With Mayor Lawrence performing his duties as Governor in Harrisburg, do you believe the Democratic party in Pittsburgh will be weakened by his absence?"  answer reads: "No, I don't think so, because he's a Democrat and the state is controlled by that party."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ernest Leech wearing light colored hat, moustache, light colored shirt, striped jacket, and dark coat with missing button, standing in front of bushes and brick house with front porch and window with blinds
